alert.note: Alert for Benton (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:58AM PST until January 04 at 7:12AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Marys River near Philomath affecting Benton County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Marys River near Philomath. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 20.0 feet, expect widespread low land and agricultural flooding. Numerous roads along the Marys are affected, and some structures near the river may begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PST Monday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest near 20.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM PST.
